content:
You can create cases in several ways. 

To view and create cases, you need Read on cases and Create on cases permissions respectively.

Your admin can set up Web-to-Case and either Email-to-Case or On-Demand Email-to-Case to automatically capture cases from your website and customer emails.

Customers can log their own cases from an Experience Cloud site, Customer Portal, Self-Service portal, or Chatter Answers.

To create a case:

Use Search to find the individualâ€™s account and then locate the contact in the Contacts related list.

Click New in the Cases related list of the contact.

Enter information for the case.

When you enter or select a contact for the Contact Name field, the Account Name field defaults to the account associated with the contact when you save the case.

To associate the case with an asset:

Select an asset from the assets listed to associate it with the case.
If you do not find a matching asset, click New to create a asset from the lookup dialog and associate it with the new case.

You can also set who sees the case, prevent a case from appearing in the Self-Service portal, and automatically assign the case using your org's active assignment rule.
title: Creating Cases in Salesforce
